h1: Pentagon blocked Biden's intelligence transition team from meeting with agencies
first_p: (CNN)The Trump administration prevented President-elect Joe Biden's transition team from meeting with its counterparts at Pentagon intelligence agencies this week, according to a former senior intelligence official familiar with intelligence transition discussions.
article_text: Pentagon blocked Biden's intelligence transition team from meeting with agencies  (CNN)The Trump administration prevented President-elect Joe Biden's transition team from meeting with its counterparts at Pentagon intelligence agencies this week, according to a former senior intelligence official familiar with intelligence transition discussions. White House exodus begins even as Trump continues to baselessly claim victoryCourts across the country hand Trump and his allies more losses as attempts to upend election results collapseWhile Trump rants about votes, none of his election security officials support himMAP: Full presidential election results

h1: New combative Ivanka Trump sparks questions about her future
first_p: (CNN)A more combative Ivanka Trump has emerged with little more than one month left in her role as adviser to President Donald Trump, as the first daughter makes a conscious effort to publicly push back on her critics.
article_text: New combative Ivanka Trump sparks questions about her future  (CNN)A more combative Ivanka Trump has emerged with little more than one month left in her role as adviser to President Donald Trump, as the first daughter makes a conscious effort to publicly push back on her critics.  White House exodus begins even as Trump continues to baselessly claim victoryCourts across the country hand Trump and his allies more losses as attempts to upend election results collapseWhile Trump rants about votes, none of his election security officials support himMAP: Full presidential election results  CNN's Jamie Gangel contributed to this report.

h1: US anti-doping bill signed into law
first_p: (CNN)US President Donald Trump announced on Friday he had signed into law the Rodchenkov Anti-Doping Act, allowing the United States to impose criminal sanctions on individuals involved in doping activities at international events.
article_text: US anti-doping bill signed into law  (CNN)US President Donald Trump announced on Friday he had signed into law the Rodchenkov Anti-Doping Act, allowing the United States to impose criminal sanctions on individuals involved in doping activities at international events.

h1: Trump's criticism of GOP Senate candidates has Republicans worried ahead of rally
first_p: (CNN)President Donald Trump heads to Georgia on Saturday to campaign for two Republican senators one month ahead of a critical runoff that will determine which party controls the Senate. But Trump's visit comes as he has spent the last several weeks consumed by his own election loss while attacking party officials in the state, casting doubt on its voting process and questioning one of the lawmakers he's urging voters to elect.
article_text: Trump's criticism of GOP Senate candidates has Republicans worried ahead of rally  (CNN)President Donald Trump heads to Georgia on Saturday to campaign for two Republican senators one month ahead of a critical runoff that will determine which party controls the Senate. But Trump's visit comes as he has spent the last several weeks consumed by his own election loss while attacking party officials in the state, casting doubt on its voting process and questioning one of the lawmakers he's urging voters to elect. CNN's Alex Rogers and Ryan Nobles contributed to this report.

h1: Courts across the country hand Trump and his allies more losses as attempts to upend election results collapse
first_p: (CNN)The Trump campaign and its allies were dealt additional blows in Michigan, Nevada, Wisconsin and Arizona on Friday as courts rejected their attempts to challenge the presidential election results.
article_text: Courts across the country hand Trump and his allies more losses as attempts to upend election results collapse  (CNN)The Trump campaign and its allies were dealt additional blows in Michigan, Nevada, Wisconsin and Arizona on Friday as courts rejected their attempts to challenge the presidential election results.

h1: White House exodus begins even as Trump continues to baselessly claim victory
first_p: (CNN)White House staffers at all levels are plotting their departures as a growing number of aides to President Donald Trump are abandoning his quest to overturn the 2020 election results -- some in frustration with the building they are leaving behind.
article_text: White House exodus begins even as Trump continues to baselessly claim victory  (CNN)White House staffers at all levels are plotting their departures as a growing number of aides to President Donald Trump are abandoning his quest to overturn the 2020 election results -- some in frustration with the building they are leaving behind.

h1: Ousted cybersecurity chief Krebs to Trump: 'These constant attacks ... are very dangerous'
first_p: (CNN)Former top cybersecurity official Chris Krebs sent a clear message to President Donald Trump on Friday: Stop attacking the integrity of last month's election because American democracy is fragile.
article_text: Ousted cybersecurity chief Krebs to Trump: 'These constant attacks ... are very dangerous'  (CNN)Former top cybersecurity official Chris Krebs sent a clear message to President Donald Trump on Friday: Stop attacking the integrity of last month's election because American democracy is fragile. CNN's Alex Marquardt contributed to this report.

h1: Trump orders a near total withdrawal of US troops from Somalia
first_p: (CNN)President Donald Trump has ordered the majority of US troops to leave Somalia "by early 2021," in just the latest major military policy decision being taken in the final days of the Trump administration.
article_text: Trump orders a near total withdrawal of US troops from Somalia  (CNN)President Donald Trump has ordered the majority of US troops to leave Somalia "by early 2021," in just the latest major military policy decision being taken in the final days of the Trump administration.

h1: Trump administration must accept new DACA applications, judge orders
first_p: (CNN)The Trump administration must post a public notice that it will accept new applications for the Obama-era program shielding undocumented immigrants who came to the US as children from deportation, a federal judge ordered Friday.
article_text: Trump administration must accept new DACA applications, judge orders  (CNN)The Trump administration must post a public notice that it will accept new applications for the Obama-era program shielding undocumented immigrants who came to the US as children from deportation, a federal judge ordered Friday.  CNN's Chandelis Duster and Maria Santana contributed to this report.

h1: While Trump rants about votes, none of his election security officials support him
first_p: (CNN)President Donald Trump is increasingly isolated in his claims of election fraud as a growing number of senior administration officials are either directly contradicting his baseless allegations or refusing to echo them.
article_text: While Trump rants about votes, none of his election security officials support him   (CNN)President Donald Trump is increasingly isolated in his claims of election fraud as a growing number of senior administration officials are either directly contradicting his baseless allegations or refusing to echo them. h1: Some Trump supporters in this Georgia county say the election system is 'rigged.' That could hurt Republicans in January
first_p: Tallapoosa, Georgia  (CNN)Sixty miles west of Atlanta, Haralson County sits a world away from Georgia's largest and booming metro area. Here, in the small towns that sit in the foothills of the Appalachian mountains, Republican roots run generations deep. In November, the county voted for Donald Trump over Joe Biden, 87% to 13% -- making it one of the most Republican-leaning areas in the state.
article_text: Some Trump supporters in this Georgia county say the election system is 'rigged.' That could hurt Republicans in January Tallapoosa, Georgia  (CNN)Sixty miles west of Atlanta, Haralson County sits a world away from Georgia's largest and booming metro area. Here, in the small towns that sit in the foothills of the Appalachian mountains, Republican roots run generations deep. In November, the county voted for Donald Trump over Joe Biden, 87% to 13% -- making it one of the most Republican-leaning areas in the state.

h1: Presidential pardon investigation involves Kushner lawyer and GOP lobbyist, sources say
first_p: (CNN)The Justice Department bribery-for-a-presidential-pardon investigation, which became public this week, involves the past efforts of well-connected Washington lawyer Abbe Lowell and Republican lobbyist and fundraiser Elliott Broidy in the early days of the Trump White House, sources tell CNN.
article_text: Presidential pardon investigation involves Kushner lawyer and GOP lobbyist, sources say  (CNN)The Justice Department bribery-for-a-presidential-pardon investigation, which became public this week, involves the past efforts of well-connected Washington lawyer Abbe Lowell and Republican lobbyist and fundraiser Elliott Broidy in the early days of the Trump White House, sources tell CNN.    CNN's Evan Perez and Pamela Brown contributed to this report.

h1: Trump attorney issues call for violence against truth-telling former election cybersecurity official
first_p: Washington  (CNN)An attorney for the Trump campaign on Monday issued a call for violence against Chris Krebs, a former cybersecurity official who was unceremoniously ousted from his post by President Donald Trump after he rejected the President's unfounded claims of widespread voter fraud.
article_text: Trump attorney issues call for violence against truth-telling former election cybersecurity official Washington  (CNN)An attorney for the Trump campaign on Monday issued a call for violence against Chris Krebs, a former cybersecurity official who was unceremoniously ousted from his post by President Donald Trump after he rejected the President's unfounded claims of widespread voter fraud.   CNN's Nikki Carvajal, Geneva Sands and Kaitlan Collins contributed to this report.

h1: Former top cybersecurity official says Trump firing by tweet was 'not how I wanted to go out'
first_p: (CNN)Christopher Krebs, the former top cybersecurity official, said President Donald Trump's decision to unceremoniously fire him via tweet last week was "not how I wanted to go out."
article_text: Former top cybersecurity official says Trump firing by tweet was 'not how I wanted to go out'  (CNN)Christopher Krebs, the former top cybersecurity official, said President Donald Trump's decision to unceremoniously fire him via tweet last week was "not how I wanted to go out." CNN's Devan Cole, Kaitlan Collins and Paul LeBlanc contributed to this report.

h1: Donald Trump is not a political genius
first_p: Jason Harrow is a constitutional lawyer and chief counsel of the non-profit Equal Citizens. The views expressed in this commentary belong solely to the author. View more opinion at CNN.
article_text: Donald Trump is not a political genius Jason Harrow is a constitutional lawyer and chief counsel of the non-profit Equal Citizens. The views expressed in this commentary belong solely to the author. View more opinion at CNN.  (CNN)There remains a widespread view that, regardless of whether you agree with President Donald Trump's policies, we must all admit that he is a shrewd politician. Fox News host Tucker Carlson and Stephen Miller, one of Trump's senior advisers, have called him a "political genius" while Dilbert creator Scott Adams has made a new career of presenting Trump as someone he calls a "Master Persuader": that is, someone with "weapons-grade persuasion skills."  Sign up for CNN Opinion's new newsletter. Join us on Twitter and Facebook

h1: Trump purges Pentagon advisory board and gives seats to former campaign managers
first_p: (CNN)President Donald Trump has purged a Pentagon business advisory board and replaced its members with his former campaign manager and deputy campaign manager, neither of whom have served in the military or have any apparent experience with the defense industry.
article_text: Trump purges Pentagon advisory board and gives seats to former campaign managers  (CNN)President Donald Trump has purged a Pentagon business advisory board and replaced its members with his former campaign manager and deputy campaign manager, neither of whom have served in the military or have any apparent experience with the defense industry.

h1: Biden on Trump administration distributing vaccine: 'There is no detailed plan'
first_p: Washington (CNN)President-elect Joe Biden said Friday that the Trump administration had shared information with his transition team about distributing a vaccine to various states, but Biden said his team had not seen a "detailed plan."
article_text: Biden on Trump administration distributing vaccine: 'There is no detailed plan'  Washington (CNN)President-elect Joe Biden said Friday that the Trump administration had shared information with his transition team about distributing a vaccine to various states, but Biden said his team had not seen a "detailed plan." h1: Supreme Court agrees to consider Medicaid work requirements
first_p: (CNN)The Supreme Court agreed Friday to review whether the Trump administration can allow states to impose work requirements in their Medicaid programs.
article_text: Supreme Court agrees to consider Medicaid work requirements  (CNN)The Supreme Court agreed Friday to review whether the Trump administration can allow states to impose work requirements in their Medicaid programs.

h1: Biden's popular vote margin over Trump tops 7 million
first_p: Washington (CNN)President-elect Joe Biden's margin over President Donald Trump in the nationwide popular vote is now more than 7 million votes and may continue to grow as several states continue counting votes.
article_text: Biden's popular vote margin over Trump tops 7 million Washington (CNN)President-elect Joe Biden's margin over President Donald Trump in the nationwide popular vote is now more than 7 million votes and may continue to grow as several states continue counting votes.

h1: What Biden gets about being president -- and Trump doesn't
first_p: Errol Louis is the host of "Inside City Hall," a nightly political show on NY1, a New York all-news channel. The opinions expressed in this commentary are his own. View more opinion articles on CNN.
article_text: What Biden gets about being president -- and Trump doesn't Errol Louis is the host of "Inside City Hall," a nightly political show on NY1, a New York all-news channel. The opinions expressed in this commentary are his own. View more opinion articles on CNN.  (CNN)It was especially refreshing to see President-elect Joe Biden and Vice President-elect Kamala Harris use their CNN interview with Jake Tapper on Thursday to make clear that leading America is, first and always, a complex effort requiring the cooperation and good will of millions. h1: The 2017 travel ban may be associated with preterm births among women from the targeted countries, study says
first_p: (CNN)The 2017 travel ban imposed by the Trump administration on seven Muslim-majority countries may be associated with an increase in preterm births among women from those countries residing in the United States, according to a new study.
article_text: The 2017 travel ban may be associated with preterm births among women from the targeted countries, study says  (CNN)The 2017 travel ban imposed by the Trump administration on seven Muslim-majority countries may be associated with an increase in preterm births among women from those countries residing in the United States, according to a new study.

h1: Trump shows how to get away with almost anything

h1: Trump raises more than $207 million since Election Day as he pushes baseless election fraud claims
first_p: (CNN)President Donald Trump's political operation has raised more than $207 million since Election Day, as the President inundates his supporters with fundraising appeals and refuses to concede his White House loss, according to figures released Thursday night by his campaign.
article_text: Trump raises more than $207 million since Election Day as he pushes baseless election fraud claims  (CNN)President Donald Trump's political operation has raised more than $207 million since Election Day, as the President inundates his supporters with fundraising appeals and refuses to concede his White House loss, according to figures released Thursday night by his campaign. CNN's Betsy Klein, David Wright, Sergio Hernandez and Casey Tolan contributed to this story.

h1: Romney calls Trump's leadership on Covid-19 'a great human tragedy'
first_p: Washington (CNN)Republican Sen. Mitt Romney on Thursday blasted President Donald Trump's leadership -- or lack thereof -- during the deadly coronavirus pandemic as "a great human tragedy."
article_text: Romney calls Trump's leadership on Covid-19 'a great human tragedy' Washington (CNN)Republican Sen. Mitt Romney on Thursday blasted President Donald Trump's leadership -- or lack thereof -- during the deadly coronavirus pandemic as "a great human tragedy."

h1: White House has held multiple pardon meetings since the election
first_p: (CNN)With a rush of pardons expected before President Donald Trump leaves office, the White House has been holding multiple pardon meetings since the election, involving the White House counsel's office and other staff, two senior administration officials told CNN.
article_text: White House has held multiple pardon meetings since the election  (CNN)With a rush of pardons expected before President Donald Trump leaves office, the White House has been holding multiple pardon meetings since the election, involving the White House counsel's office and other staff, two senior administration officials told CNN.  CNN's Jim Acosta contributed to this report.

h1: Trump praised QAnon during meeting about keeping the Senate
first_p: Washington (CNN)President Donald Trump brought up Rep.-elect Marjorie Taylor Greene's support for the dangerous QAnon conspiracy theory during a meeting on keeping the Senate with Majority Leader Mitch McConnell and other aides, a source familiar with the matter confirmed to CNN.
article_text: Trump praised QAnon during meeting about keeping the Senate Washington (CNN)President Donald Trump brought up Rep.-elect Marjorie Taylor Greene's support for the dangerous QAnon conspiracy theory during a meeting on keeping the Senate with Majority Leader Mitch McConnell and other aides, a source familiar with the matter confirmed to CNN.  Expect a 'flurry' of pardons before Trump leaves office, source saysThe legal threats and headaches fueling pardon appeals from Trump's family and friendsTrump frustrated with Barr after election comments but officials don't want AG fired, sources sayMAP: Full presidential election results  CNN's Alex Rogers and Veronica Stracqualursi contributed to this report.

h1: Biden team weighs North Korea policy as the era of Trump's 'love' letters with Kim ends
first_p: (CNN)President-elect Joe Biden's foreign policy team will soon have access to the letters President Donald Trump exchanged with North Korean Leader Kim Jong Un, correspondence that belongs to the US government -- not Trump -- and could provide insight into one of the world's most enigmatic leaders.
article_text: Biden team weighs North Korea policy as the era of Trump's 'love' letters with Kim ends  (CNN)President-elect Joe Biden's foreign policy team will soon have access to the letters President Donald Trump exchanged with North Korean Leader Kim Jong Un, correspondence that belongs to the US government -- not Trump -- and could provide insight into one of the world's most enigmatic leaders.

h1: The legal threats and headaches fueling pardon appeals from Trump's family and friends
first_p: (CNN)With the clock ticking on Donald Trump's presidency, a number of associates have appealed to him in recent days in hopes of obtaining pardons before he leaves office in January. While some face imminent legal threats, others are staring down potential legal headaches that a presidential pardon likely won't alleviate.
article_text: The legal threats and headaches fueling pardon appeals from Trump's family and friends   (CNN)With the clock ticking on Donald Trump's presidency, a number of associates have appealed to him in recent days in hopes of obtaining pardons before he leaves office in January. While some face imminent legal threats, others are staring down potential legal headaches that a presidential pardon likely won't alleviate.

h1: Parents of 628 migrant children separated at border still have not been found, court filing says
first_p: (CNN)The parents of 628 migrant children separated from their families due to Trump administration policies at the US-Mexico border between 2017 and 2018 have still not been located, according to a Wednesday court filing.
article_text: Parents of 628 migrant children separated at border still have not been found, court filing says  (CNN)The parents of 628 migrant children separated from their families due to Trump administration policies at the US-Mexico border between 2017 and 2018 have still not been located, according to a Wednesday court filing.

While some face imminent legal threats, others are staring down potential legal headaches that a presidential pardon likely won't alleviate.

h1: Trump frustrated with Barr after election comments but officials don't want AG fired, sources say
first_p: (CNN)President Donald Trump is frustrated with Attorney General William Barr after his comments to The Associated Press breaking from the President's false claims of fraud in the election, two sources tell CNN.
article_text: Trump frustrated with Barr after election comments but officials don't want AG fired, sources say  (CNN)President Donald Trump is frustrated with Attorney General William Barr after his comments to The Associated Press breaking from the President's false claims of fraud in the election, two sources tell CNN. CNN's Evan Perez contributed to this report.

h1: US blocks cotton imports from China region over reported forced-labor abuses
first_p: (CNN)The Trump administration announced Wednesday that it will block imports of cotton, reportedly produced with forced labor, from China's western Xinjiang region.
article_text: US blocks cotton imports from China region over reported forced-labor abuses  (CNN)The Trump administration announced Wednesday that it will block imports of cotton, reportedly produced with forced labor, from China's western Xinjiang region. CNN's Nectar Gan, Ben Westcott and James Griffiths contributed to this report.

h1: Ivanka Trump was deposed Tuesday in DC attorney general's inauguration lawsuit
first_p: (CNN)Ivanka Trump, the President's daughter and adviser, sat for a deposition Tuesday with investigators from the Washington, DC, attorney general's office as part of its lawsuit alleging the misuse of inaugural funds, according to a court filing.
article_text: Ivanka Trump was deposed Tuesday in DC attorney general's inauguration lawsuit  (CNN)Ivanka Trump, the President's daughter and adviser, sat for a deposition Tuesday with investigators from the Washington, DC, attorney general's office as part of its lawsuit alleging the misuse of inaugural funds, according to a court filing.  pic.twitter.com/DERU9YJLcL

h1: Federal appeals court rules against the Trump administration's public charge rule
first_p: (CNN)The Ninth Circuit Court of Appeals on Wednesday ruled against the Trump administration's controversial "public charge" rule that critics say has a chilling effect on immigrants who may need to seek medical assistance, marking the latest blow against the regulation.
article_text: Federal appeals court rules against the Trump administration's public charge rule  (CNN)The Ninth Circuit Court of Appeals on Wednesday ruled against the Trump administration's controversial "public charge" rule that critics say has a chilling effect on immigrants who may need to seek medical assistance, marking the latest blow against the regulation.

h1: For Joe Biden, a key challenge in Central America
first_p: Daniel V. Speckhard, a former US ambassador to Greece and Belarus, served as deputy chief of mission at the US Embassy in Iraq and is a former senior official at NATO. He is also the president and CEO of Corus International, a family of faith-based organizations, including Lutheran World Relief and IMA World Health. The views expressed in this commentary are his own. View more opinion at CNN.
article_text: For Joe Biden, a key challenge in Central America Daniel V. Speckhard, a former US ambassador to Greece and Belarus, served as deputy chief of mission at the US Embassy in Iraq and is a former senior official at NATO. He is also the president and CEO of Corus International, a family of faith-based organizations, including Lutheran World Relief and IMA World Health. The views expressed in this commentary are his own. View more opinion at CNN.  (CNN)In better times, the verdant hills of Jinotega, Nicaragua, are carpeted with coffee cherries that yield a superior brew and provide a decent living for the region's farming families. Sign up for CNN Opinion's new newsletter. Join us on Twitter and Facebook

h1: Trump using military funding as leverage in fight with tech giants
first_p: (CNN)President Donald Trump's threat Tuesday to veto an annual defense bill unless Congress removes legal protections for social media companies drew swift, sharp bipartisan pushback from lawmakers who charged Trump was using leverage over the troops to settle personal scores.
article_text: Trump using military funding as leverage in fight with tech giants  (CNN)President Donald Trump's threat Tuesday to veto an annual defense bill unless Congress removes legal protections for social media companies drew swift, sharp bipartisan pushback from lawmakers who charged Trump was using leverage over the troops to settle personal scores. CNN's Manu Raju, Betsy Klein and Joe Johns contributed to this report

h1: Biden readies major stimulus push and flurry of executive actions in first 100 days
first_p: (CNN)President-elect Joe Biden and his transition team are preparing for an early, all-out push to pass an ambitious new stimulus bill, while also drawing up plans for a flurry of executive actions aimed at delivering on campaign promises and undoing the Trump administration's efforts to undermine key government agencies.

h1: US official says Israel was behind assassination of Iranian scientist
first_p: Washington (CNN)A senior US administration official said Israel was behind the assassination of Iran's top nuclear scientist but declined to give details about whether the Trump administration knew about the attack before it was carried out or provided support.
article_text: US official says Israel was behind assassination of Iranian scientist Washington (CNN)A senior US administration official said Israel was behind the assassination of Iran's top nuclear scientist but declined to give details about whether the Trump administration knew about the attack before it was carried out or provided support. h1: Trump talks of 'another four years' during White House Christmas reception
first_p: Washington (CNN)President Donald Trump talked during a Christmas reception at the White House on Tuesday about spending four more years in office -- whether that starts in January 2021 or January 2025, according to a source familiar with his comments.
article_text: Trump talks of 'another four years' during White House Christmas reception   Washington (CNN)President Donald Trump talked during a Christmas reception at the White House on Tuesday about spending four more years in office -- whether that starts in January 2021 or January 2025, according to a source familiar with his comments. h1: Georgia election official pleads with Trump and Republicans to stop 'inspiring' acts of violence
first_p: (CNN)A Georgia election official on Tuesday condemned threats of physical violence and intimidation against election workers and officials, pleading with President Donald Trump to denounce the threats and urging both of the state's Republican senators to intervene.
article_text: Georgia election official pleads with Trump and Republicans to stop 'inspiring' acts of violence  (CNN)A Georgia election official on Tuesday condemned threats of physical violence and intimidation against election workers and officials, pleading with President Donald Trump to denounce the threats and urging both of the state's Republican senators to intervene. CNN's Caroline Kenny and Ryan Nobles contributed to this report.

h1: McConnell pushing to lock down GOP support for new Covid relief plan as pressure grows to cut a deal
first_p: (CNN)Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell is circulating a new relief plan as part of a last-ditch effort to pass a bill to prop up the struggling economy before year's end, moving to lock down Republican support even as a number of his own members and Democrats push for a different approach.
article_text: McConnell pushing to lock down GOP support for new Covid relief plan as pressure grows to cut a deal  (CNN)Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell is circulating a new relief plan as part of a last-ditch effort to pass a bill to prop up the struggling economy before year's end, moving to lock down Republican support even as a number of his own members and Democrats push for a different approach. CNN's Lauren Fox contributed to this report.

h1: GOP silence on Trump's false election claims recalls McCarthy era
first_p: (CNN)The silence of congressional Republican leaders as President Donald Trump's unfounded claims of election fraud grow wilder and more venomous increasingly resembles the party's deference to Sen. Joe McCarthy during the worst excesses of his anti-Communist crusade in the early 1950s.
article_text: GOP silence on Trump's false election claims recalls McCarthy era  (CNN)The silence of congressional Republican leaders as President Donald Trump's unfounded claims of election fraud grow wilder and more venomous increasingly resembles the party's deference to Sen. Joe McCarthy during the worst excesses of his anti-Communist crusade in the early 1950s.

h1: President Donald Trump raises more than $170 million since Election Day as he pushes baseless fraud claims
first_p: (CNN)President Donald Trump and his political operation have raised more than $170 million since Election Day, a person familiar with the matter said -- a massive fundraising haul fueled by Trump's baseless allegations that the election was rigged.

h1: GOP senators' strategy on Trump's election fraud claims: Keep quiet and carry on
first_p: (CNN)A wide range of Republican senators are shrugging off President Donald Trump's evidence-free claims that mass voter fraud cost him the election, ignoring their party leader's relentless attacks against a foundation of American democracy amid their growing expectation that the matter will be resolved within two weeks -- without their involvement.

h1: Meadows to meet with FDA chief as Trump asks about status of vaccine emergency approval
first_p: (CNN)White House chief of staff Mark Meadows is scheduled to meet with Food and Drug Administration Commissioner Stephen Hahn in the West Wing Tuesday, as President Donald Trump has privately demanded to know why the agency hasn't granted emergency use for Pfizer's coronavirus vaccine yet, according to two sources.
article_text: Meadows to meet with FDA chief as Trump asks about status of vaccine emergency approval  (CNN)White House chief of staff Mark Meadows is scheduled to meet with Food and Drug Administration Commissioner Stephen Hahn in the West Wing Tuesday, as President Donald Trump has privately demanded to know why the agency hasn't granted emergency use for Pfizer's coronavirus vaccine yet, according to two sources.

h1: Trump still has power to make policy. Watch what he does
first_p: (CNN)Another key state -- Arizona -- certified its election results on Monday. And Wisconsin did too, after a recount requested by Republicans wound up affirming Joe Biden's victory there. Yet President Donald Trump is in a state of suspended animation, pushing conspiracy theories about his loss as the world moves on without him.
article_text: Trump still has power to make policy. Watch what he does  (CNN)Another key state -- Arizona -- certified its election results on Monday. And Wisconsin did too, after a recount requested by Republicans wound up affirming Joe Biden's victory there. Yet President Donald Trump is in a state of suspended animation, pushing conspiracy theories about his loss as the world moves on without him. h1: Trump sees 'the writing on the wall' despite what he maintains publicly about the election, advisers say
first_p: (CNN)Despite what President Donald Trump is tweeting and saying publicly in the wake of Arizona and Wisconsin certifying President-elect Joe Biden's victory Monday, Trump sees the scoreboard and understands he has no chance of hanging on to the presidency, two White House advisers told CNN.
article_text: Trump sees 'the writing on the wall' despite what he maintains publicly about the election, advisers say   (CNN)Despite what President Donald Trump is tweeting and saying publicly in the wake of Arizona and Wisconsin certifying President-elect Joe Biden's victory Monday, Trump sees the scoreboard and understands he has no chance of hanging on to the presidency, two White House advisers told CNN. h1: Justice Department releases Trump's pardon of Flynn and asks court for dismissal
first_p: (CNN)The Justice Department on Monday released a copy of President Donald Trump's pardon of former national security adviser Michael Flynn -- giving Flynn far-reaching absolution from lying and foreign lobbying crimes he admitted to in 2017 and any other possible related crimes.
article_text: Justice Department releases Trump's pardon of Flynn and asks court for dismissal  (CNN)The Justice Department on Monday released a copy of President Donald Trump's pardon of former national security adviser Michael Flynn -- giving Flynn far-reaching absolution from lying and foreign lobbying crimes he admitted to in 2017 and any other possible related crimes.  CNN's Pamela Brown, Jim Acosta, Kaitlan Collins, Paul LeBlanc and Maegan Vazquez contributed to this report.

h1: Fact-checking Trump's falsehood-filled weekend
first_p: Washington (CNN)President Donald Trump was relatively quiet over the Thanksgiving holiday. But by Friday he was back to lighting up Twitter with a range of false claims about the 2020 presidential election. From Friday evening to Sunday evening, Trump tweeted and retweeted more than a dozen claims of election fraud, 14 of which were flagged by Twitter as disputed or misleading.
article_text: Fact-checking Trump's falsehood-filled weekend Washington (CNN)President Donald Trump was relatively quiet over the Thanksgiving holiday. But by Friday he was back to lighting up Twitter with a range of false claims about the 2020 presidential election. From Friday evening to Sunday evening, Trump tweeted and retweeted more than a dozen claims of election fraud, 14 of which were flagged by Twitter as disputed or misleading. CNN's Casey Tolan contributed to this article.

h1: Why Joe Biden's broken foot reveals how different his White House will be from Donald Trump's
first_p: (CNN)Days before Thanksgiving last year, President Donald Trump made an unannounced and previously unscheduled trip to Walter Reed medical center. The White House said the trip was for a "quick exam and labs." We still don't know why he actually went -- or what the outcome of his visit was.
article_text: Why Joe Biden's broken foot reveals how different his White House will be from Donald Trump's  (CNN)Days before Thanksgiving last year, President Donald Trump made an unannounced and previously unscheduled trip to Walter Reed medical center. h1: Biden administration prepares to inherit controversial Trump immigration policies
first_p: (CNN)When President-elect Joe Biden comes into office, he will inherit the Trump administration's restrictionist immigration agenda, which cut access to asylum and has kept migrants in limbo in Mexico while they await humanitarian protection in the US.

Democrats deride 'dark' money, but a new analysis shows it helped boost Joe BidenBiden picks up small number of votes in Milwaukee County after Trump-requested recountPompeo says State Department will 'honor' promise to conduct transition to Biden administrationMAP: Full election results CNN's Lauren Fox contributed to this report.

h1: Trump's legal defeats pile up while his attacks on Georgia's election system raise GOP concerns
first_p: (CNN)President Donald Trump found himself trapped in an election riddle of his own making Friday -- continuing to push false claims that the election was a "total scam," even after another humiliating court rebuke in Pennsylvania, while insisting that his supporters should turn out in Georgia's January Senate runoff elections despite concerns about fraud that he has sown.
article_text: Trump's legal defeats pile up while his attacks on Georgia's election system raise GOP concerns   (CNN)President Donald Trump found himself trapped in an election riddle of his own making Friday -- continuing to push false claims that the election was a "total scam," even after another humiliating court rebuke in Pennsylvania, while insisting that his supporters should turn out in Georgia's January Senate runoff elections despite concerns about fraud that he has sown.  Democrats deride 'dark' money, but a new analysis shows it helped boost Joe BidenBiden picks up small number of votes in Milwaukee County after Trump-requested recountPompeo says State Department will 'honor' promise to conduct transition to Biden administrationMAP: Full election results Federal appeals court slams Trump campaign efforts to turn tide in Pennsylvania ruling, saying 'claims have no merit'Trump's legal defeats pile up while his attacks on Georgia's election system raise GOP concernsAnalysis: Trump finally signals a White House exit as huge challenges loom for BidenMAP: Full presidential election results CNN's Donald Judd and Ryan Nobles contributed to this report.

h1: Washington Post: White House Budget office moving to reclassify key roles under Trump executive order
first_p: (CNN)Following an executive order President Donald Trump signed last month, the Office of Management and Budget is moving to reclassify 88% of its workforce into a new job classification that would give the federal government more flexibility to fire these employees without going through a lengthy appeals process, The Washington Post reported Friday.
article_text: Washington Post: White House Budget office moving to reclassify key roles under Trump executive order   (CNN)Following an executive order President Donald Trump signed last month, the Office of Management and Budget is moving to reclassify 88% of its workforce into a new job classification that would give the federal government more flexibility to fire these employees without going through a lengthy appeals process, The Washington Post reported Friday. Federal appeals court slams Trump campaign efforts to turn tide in Pennsylvania ruling, saying 'claims have no merit'Trump's legal defeats pile up while his attacks on Georgia's election system raise GOP concernsAnalysis: Trump finally signals a White House exit as huge challenges loom for BidenMAP: Full presidential election results CNN's Alison Main, Maegan Vazquez and Ross Levitt contributed to this report.

h1: Former top cybersecurity official says Trump firing by tweet was 'not how I wanted to go out'
first_p: (CNN)Christopher Krebs, the former top cybersecurity official, said President Donald Trump's decision to unceremoniously fire him via tweet last week was "not how I wanted to go out."
article_text: Former top cybersecurity official says Trump firing by tweet was 'not how I wanted to go out'  (CNN)Christopher Krebs, the former top cybersecurity official, said President Donald Trump's decision to unceremoniously fire him via tweet last week was "not how I wanted to go out." CNN's Devan Cole, Kaitlan Collins and Paul LeBlanc contributed to this report.

h1: Justice Department rushing to expand execution methods like firing squads for federal death row inmates
first_p: (CNN)The Justice Department has rushed to change the rules around federal death penalties as they expedite a slew of scheduled executions in the final days of the Trump administration, including expanding possible execution methods to include electrocution and death by firing squad.
article_text: Justice Department rushing to expand execution methods like firing squads for federal death row inmates  (CNN)The Justice Department has rushed to change the rules around federal death penalties as they expedite a slew of scheduled executions in the final days of the Trump administration, including expanding possible execution methods to include electrocution and death by firing squad.   CNN's Jessica Schneider contributed to this report.
